Use a different digging tool: If the ground is too hard to dig into, try using a different digging tool such as a jackhammer or a rock drill. These tools are designed to break through hard surfaces and can make digging much easier.

Plant raised beds: Instead of digging into the ground, consider planting raised beds. This involves building a raised area in the ground where you can plant your vegetables or flowers. This can be a great option if the ground is too hard to dig into.

Use a hydroponic system: A hydroponic system is a method of growing plants that doesn't require soil. Instead, plants are grown in a nutrient-rich solution that is free of contaminants. This can be a great option if the ground is too hard to dig into.

Use a vertical garden: A vertical garden is a type of garden that is built vertically, rather than horizontally. This can be a great option if you don't have a lot of space or if the ground is too hard to dig into.

Use a container garden: A container garden is a type of garden that is grown in containers, such as pots or boxes. This can be a great option if the ground is too hard to dig into, as you can simply place your containers on a hard surface and start growing your plants.
